snippet: Ms. Lessing was an uninhibited and outspoken novelist who produced dozens of novels, short stories, essays and poems, embarking on dizzying and at times stultifying literary experiments.
abstract: Doris Lessing, uninhibited and outspoken novelist who won the 2007 Nobel Prize for a lifetime of writing that shattered convention, both social and artistic, dies at age 94; Lessing's breakthrough novel The Golden Notebook remains her best-known work, cherished for its structural inventiveness and its groundbreaking exploration of the inner lives of women.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Lessing was an uninhibited and outspoken novelist who produced dozens of novels, short stories, essays and poems, embarking on dizzying and at times stultifying literary experiments.

headline.main: Doris Lessing, Author Who Swept Aside Convention, Is Dead at 94
headline.print_headline: Sweeping Aside Convention in Novels and Life
